snippet: These days, a candidate is committing political malpractice without a super PAC raking in unlimited donations (often from mom and dad). Is this bribery run amok?
abstract: Editorial criticizes proliferation of family-financed super PACs in competitive congressional elections, noting there are at least 64 dedicated to candidates this season; contends such groups are only latest and most outrageous examples of how super PACs are used to evade limits on donations; holds Congress does have means to put a stop to such contributions, but with so many congressional members depending on them, likelihood of that happening is diminished.
lead_paragraph: These days, a candidate is committing political malpractice without a super PAC raking in unlimited donations (often from mom and dad). Is this bribery run amok?
